Text:
In 5 days, DC's second statue in the US Capitol will be unveiled in a ceremony hosted by @SpeakerPelosi. 

Each state is entitled to two statues in the Capitol, so DC’s second statue will be a symbolic step toward #DCStatehood.

More: https://t.co/tWIV0VQ9ar

I requested a meeting with Capitol Police Chief Manger to discuss security preparations for the trucker convoy and State of the Union address.

The meeting is scheduled for tomorrow afternoon.

More: https://t.co/RihwJrKQtx

I spoke to @RamirezReports about the possible reinstallation of temporary fencing at the Capitol ahead of the trucker convoy reaching DC and next week's State of the Union.

Watch this evening at 5:00 and 6:00 on @Fox5DC.

The trucker convoy is only the latest reminder that DC's mayor doesn’t have the authority to deploy the DC National Guard, unlike governors of states and territories for their Guards.

My DC National Guard Home Rule Act would give DC this authority, as would my #DCStatehood bill.

In 6 days, DC's second statue in the US Capitol will be unveiled in a ceremony hosted by @SpeakerPelosi. 

Each state is entitled to two statues in the Capitol, so DC’s second statue will be a symbolic step toward #DCStatehood.

More: https://t.co/tWIV0VQ9ar

In 7 days, DC's second statue in the US Capitol will be unveiled in a ceremony hosted by @SpeakerPelosi. 

Each state is entitled to two statues in the Capitol, so DC’s second statue will be a symbolic step toward #DCStatehood.

More: https://t.co/tWIV0VQ9ar
Statement: https://t.co/Jk1WvY0HOY

.@Rep_Clyde wants to return DC to a full colony by abolishing the DC government and having Congress run DC.

This is a profoundly undemocratic throwback and deeply offensive to the nearly 700,000 residents of DC.

We will defeat his efforts + prevail on #DCStatehood. https://t.co/6T5j1dAXQt

Thank you to Senate Democrats for defeating yesterday @TedCruz's amendment that would have prohibited DC from providing local funds to its schools because it has a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for students.

#DCStatehood #HandsOffDC

Full statement: https://t.co/QrnKbwI5vh
Soon. https://t.co/OVo7He1yab

Congress owes DC veterans and servicemembers more than a debt of gratitude.
 
They’ve served and died for a country that denies them voting representation in Congress and full local self-government.
 
They deserve #DCStatehood.

Leading up to this Valentine's Day, my office collected 501 Valentines from elementary schools across DC to be delivered to the Armed Forces Retirement Home.
 
Thanks to all the talented young people across DC for drawing such beautiful cards. https://t.co/Hy79KFxmZW

Tomorrow at 6:00 p.m., I will hold a virtual town hall meeting on infrastructure investments in Union Station. 

To attend, RSVP by emailing NortonEvents@mail.house.gov by noon tomorrow, 2/17.

More: https://t.co/oSnLDbOGdh

The Senate must confirm Dr. Lisa Cook to serve on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. 
 
She must be confirmed; further delay is not an option.

Today, I introduced the DC Courts Improvement Act to make several changes to the local DC courts to help them run more efficiently to address the needs of DC.

Under the DC Home Rule Act, only Congress can make these changes.

Details: https://t.co/Hpk2ezpeuD

Last week, I requested a meeting with the National Park Service, Army Corps of Engineers, and Metro to discuss the recent discovery of an unexploded ordnance on the Fort Totten Trail in DC.

More information: https://t.co/oTpWaUNyBK

In 13 days, DC's second statue in the US Capitol will be unveiled in a ceremony hosted by @SpeakerPelosi. 

Each state is entitled to two statues in the Capitol, so DC’s second statue will be a symbolic step toward #DCStatehood.

More: https://t.co/tWIV0VQ9ar

Yesterday, I talked to @Meagan_Flynn about the recent radical Republican attacks on DC home rule.

Read the article here: https://t.co/LQgZ8diXjO

My love language is #DCStatehood.

How about you? https://t.co/2wzrMmPfye

This great American statesman holds a special place in our country and in the hearts of DC residents, who chose his statue to represent the District in the Capitol.

Details: https://t.co/vuUtSa3ToX
Today, we celebrate the 204th birthday of Frederick Douglass, a longtime DC resident avid proponent of equal rights for DC residents.
https://t.co/JCbQ8CfhW7

I encourage you to read this article to see the utter contempt House Republicans have for all DC residents, a plurality of whom are Black. 

Republicans want to abolish the DC government and have Congress manage DC.

I will defeat their undemocratic efforts. #DCStatehood

Today, I highlighted the 22 bills in my #FreeAndEqualDC Series I've introduced this Congress.

Though #DCStatehood is my first priority, at the same time, I'm working to ensure DC is treated equally to the states in smaller ways.

Details: https://t.co/G2bhWZJz2J

@OversightDems DC residents have been contacting my office in record numbers about delayed and undelivered mail.

The situation is untenable. We need answers. Changes need to be made to the Postal Service, and quickly.
While today's @OversightDems hearing is focused on the delivery issues in the Baltimore area, I would be remiss if I did not mention that DC is facing problems with delivery as well.

Last week, I participated in an @OversightDems hearing on climate change. 

As chair of the Subcommittee on Highways & Transit, I'm leading the efforts in the House to combat climate change caused by the transportation sector.

Republicans told the press they plan to try to limit DC's authority to govern itself if they take the House next Congress, including by repealing the Home Rule Act.

Such anti-democratic rhetoric shows they fear #DCStatehood is closer than ever.

More: https://t.co/oM98uAyrwi
#DCStatehood https://t.co/uf1FhpF40L

As Republican-led states try to stop the teaching of the role of race in American history, I introduced a bill to create a $30m grant program for schools to train teachers, principals and other personnel on implicit bias.

Details: https://t.co/ilBzvJqa0m

DC’s lack of autonomy has life-and-death consequences.

Congress used to prohibit DC from using local funds on needle exchange.

Since I got the prohibition removed, new HIV cases attributable to injection drug use have decreased by 99%, from 150 per year to 1. 

#DCStatehood

At 9:15 I'll be on @7NewsDC to recap yesterday's hearing on Metro.

Watch: https://t.co/phsLLQYz0X
The safety of our children at school is our number one priority and these threats must be investigated and prosecuted to the full extent of the law.
The increasing number of bomb threats made against DC schools, including @DunbarHSDC, @RBHSMonarchs, and now @RooseveltHSDC, is deeply concerning and disruptive for our city.
I warned in my remarks that these mail delivery problems in DC and throughout the country need immediate action. https://t.co/rcCbNZn3qp

Yesterday, I spoke on the House floor in support of the Postal Service Reform Act, which the House passed last night.

I have repeatedly written to @USPS to raise my concerns about delayed and undelivered mail in DC.
@TheOtherMandela Hello.

I spoke to @Meagan_Flynn about the bill Senator Booker and I are introducing to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the 200,000 African Americans who fought for the Union in the Civil War.
 
https://t.co/YxiO6XGCQn
#DCStatehood https://t.co/IsDG9YwyCx

It took 11 years to get DC’s first statue in the Capitol, and nine years later, DC is about to get its second. 

DC prevailed on the two statues, and DC will prevail on #DCStatehood.
Twenty years ago, I first introduced a bill to give DC two statues in the Capitol, like the states. Republicans fought the bill because they said it was tantamount to #DCStatehood.

DC’s statue of Pierre L'Enfant with join DC’s statue of Frederick Douglass, which I got moved to the Capitol in 2013.

Statement: https://t.co/oajyOOmX2U https://t.co/DDnEArovAQ

Today, @SpeakerPelosi and I announced that DC will score a major victory toward #DCStatehood on 2/28, when DC's second statue in the Capitol is unveiled in a ceremony. Under federal law, each state is entitled to two statues in the Capitol.

As a member of Congress, I have a bill to create a national commission to combat sexual harassment.

No one should be subjected to sexual harassment or assault at their workplace.

Last week, I was pleased to participate in the @OversightDems roundtable on workplace misconduct at the Wash Commanders.

As the first woman to chair the @USEEOC, I issued the first guidelines, later upheld by SCOTUS, holding sexual harassment as a form of gender discrimination.
My statement: https://t.co/FVRwuM34qH

In the 7th attack on local DC vaccine mandates this Congress, 49 Republicans vowed to vote against the FY22 appropriations bills unless they defund both federal and DC COVID-19 vaccine mandates.

The current FY22 continuing resolution expires on Feb. 18.

The bomb threats made against HBCUs, including @HowardU and @UDC_EDU, and horrifyingly timed as #BlackHistoryMonth begins, are unacceptable and must be investigated and prosecuted to the fullest extent possible.

https://t.co/w5NOC5IrvU
@DCStatehood_ Boooo.

In my first term in Congress, in 1992, I had a bill signed into law authorizing a memorial on federal land in DC to honor the African Americans who fought for the Union in the Civil War. 
 
As #BlackHistoryMonth begins, it is critical to remember these brave Americans. https://t.co/BKZGBvUpvr

Today, in the first week of #BlackHistoryMonth, Senator @CoryBooker and I announced that we'll introduce a bill to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the 200,000 African American soldiers who fought for the Union in the Civil War.

More: https://t.co/9JJHHaHRKE https://t.co/3cDX8scNtq

Yesterday, the @OversightDems Committee passed my bill to require the Commanding General of the DC National Guard, the top official in the DCNG, to live in DC. 

The Commanding General is appointed by the president and is a federal official.

More: https://t.co/kBotpRyBai

This bill would prevent future presidents from moving federal agency headquarters away from the NCR to score political points, as Trump did.

Details: https://t.co/I97p4q6PRN
Today, I reintroduced my bill to prohibit the relocation of federal agency headquarters out of the National Capital Region without congressional approval.

Today at 10:00 I'll be participating in an @OversightDems roundtable on the workplace culture at the Washington Commanders.

Watch: https://t.co/tHgTogrmzO

Oh, just chairing a @TransportDems hearing on automated vehicles. So many witnesses, one gets thirsty!

Watch here: https://t.co/j8kMke5pL7 https://t.co/0IKZXPnehO
Full statement: https://t.co/aJrpZw5prE

After the Senate today confirmed the first local DC judge this Congress, I called for passage of my bill to eliminate the Senate confirmation requirement for these judges and to instead allow appointment after a review period, which is the same process used for DC bills.

Today, on the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth, I am reminded of Carter G. Woodson, the father of Black History Month. 

I had a bill signed into law that made his home in DC a unit of the National Park System.

Tomorrow at 11:00 am I will chair a @TransportDems hearing of the Highways & Transit Subcommittee on automated vehicles. 

Details: https://t.co/YgaITytlAV

I’m very pleased DC Circuit Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson is widely considered a leading contender for the next Supreme Court justice. She is a #DC resident, was appointed to the US district court in DC by President Obama on my recommendation and would make an outstanding justice.

The @OversightDems Committee will mark up my bill to require the Commanding Gen. of the DC Natl Guard, a federal official, to reside in DC. 

The markup will be on Wednesday, 2/2 at 10:00 am and will be live streamed on the committee’s website.

Details: https://t.co/ez20uaCsip
Fight climate change. Build high-speed rail. Pass it on. #CleanGreenHSR https://t.co/zSAx0MVrpa

One of my Twitter followers dreams of completing a list of each member of Congress's favorite Taylor Swift song, so I'm filling in one more entry.

My favorite @taylorswift13 song is:

We Are Never Ever Getting Back Together (with Maryland) (#DCStatehood) https://t.co/ckDkbU2Mkn

Today, I highlighted the legislative progress on my bills this Congress. I have introduced *80* so far, with more to come.

I was ranked as the most effective House Democrat in the 115th Congress by the Center for Effective Lawmaking.

Details: https://t.co/OMVHxQ2Xr7 https://t.co/NU67mCiR5s
@theHillisHome Let’s make it happen.

As I have consistently done in the past, I will defeat these attacks on DC home rule. #HandsOffDC #DCStatehood

Details: https://t.co/Mx42BiDbyV

1) Education: Four attacks on DC education policy.

2) Guns: One attack on DC gun policy.

3) Health Care: 11 attacks on DC vaccine and abortion policies.

4) Law Enforcement: Three attacks on DC law enforcement policy.

5) Transportation: two attacks on DC traffic laws.

While I am accustomed to Republicans from far-away places introducing legislation to overturn local DC policies, this Congress they have been particularly active + intrusive.

I'm treating this list as my official "To Do" list of legislation to defeat.

Let's review.
Updated link to live stream: https://t.co/ZJmnEWzM1W https://t.co/Nr0ulPIvRY

Later this morning, I’ll speak at a press event with @SecretaryPete and @SecondGentleman Emhoff to support an important DOT announcement regarding roadway safety.
 
Watch starting at 9:30 am: https://t.co/cW7kRW83Zq
@barbarageffen I’m working on it. #DCStatehood.

I will watch for results from the increased overtime, Sunday delivery, and ability to loan carriers to offices facing staffing challenges.

Details: https://t.co/vR5ecsifnE

.@USPS responded to my recent letter, saying that the terminations amid the current DC-wide mail delivery crisis were of temporary employees, and it is taking other measures to increase delivery speed.

Today, I reintroduced my bill to give DC complete authority to set the date of special elections for local offices, as other jurisdictions have.

This bill will strengthen DC's home-rule authority and does not require #DCStatehood.

Details: https://t.co/z6QUD70wKB https://t.co/JkvUL5koPk

As federal tax filing season kicks off today, I remind the American people DC pays:

✅More in federal taxes per capita than any state
✅More federal taxes overall than 21 states

Yet DC residents still don’t have voting representation in Congress. The remedy is #DCStatehood.

I will hold a virtual town hall via Zoom on road safety for all users on Thursday, 1/27 at 6:00 pm. 

To attend, RSVP by 5:00 on 1/26 by emailing NortonEvents@mail.house.gov.

Details: https://t.co/lCvMNdkB29
#HandsOffDC

#RoeVWade not only guarantees the legal right to abortion, but protects DC in particular.

If overturned, a future Republican Congress could ban abortions in DC completely.

Today, on the 49th anniversary of Roe, we must recognize its significance while pushing to codify it. https://t.co/aYRUL6mn9m

My thanks to @SenSchumer for recognizing the vacancy crisis on the local DC courts and for putting an end to obstruction by @SenateGOP on the nominees to these courts by filing cloture today on 7 of these nominees.

Details: https://t.co/ML0N4B39F8 https://t.co/r2eeeZ3gCb
Release: https://t.co/VRmZsxLIuI

Today, I reiterated my pledge to defeat the 20+ bills and amendments filed this Congress to overturn local DC policies on issues ranging from vaccines and education to police and speed limits.

These attacks show the critical importance of #DCStatehood. https://t.co/syGlURAnjx
@TriSalvagni @SharonsSpeaking #DCStatehood!
More #GoodTrouble. I thank @RepBowman for his sacrifice for the worthy cause of voting rights – at a time when focused attention is most necessary. https://t.co/yOSkCnbQOI
@councilofdc Details: https://t.co/Bpa4ZaXrKj

I introduced a bill to redesignate the DC Mayor as Governor and @CouncilOfDC as Legislative Assembly.

The bill highlights that there would be a seamless transition to #DCStatehood since DC already operates like a state despite being denied equal rights. https://t.co/Deu4ocIQOh

The @NRDems Committee passed my bill today to create a memorial on federal land in DC for enslaved persons.

We must honor the personhood of these individuals, who were repeatedly assumed to have none, so that they will never be forgotten.

Release: https://t.co/VT7EYIERl8

Today, I announced I will file legislation to direct @USACEHQ to conduct two studies: 

One on alternative drinking water sources for DC in case the Potomac River becomes unusable, and the second on flood mitigation in the Federal Triangle area.

Details: https://t.co/wV6eGzwJlD

Thank you to @ChrisVanHollen and @SenatorCardin for introducing the Senate companion to my bill with @RepRaskin to remove the name of segregationist Francis Newlands from Chevy Chase Circle, which is federal property.

Read the @DCist piece for more: https://t.co/zEMDXGgAhS

I spoke to @ReporterCioffi of @RollCall about how food facilities in the Capitol complex are not subject to DC's common-sense COVID-19 vaccination documentation requirement, and why that's particularly dangerous. 

Read the article here: https://t.co/hxlqIGpGYI
Details: https://t.co/QvefwRs81Z

.@SenRandPaul of KY introduced a bill to overturn two DC COVID-19 vaccine policies.

He is the 6th member this Congress to introduce a bill to overturn a DC vaccine policy. The others are from TX, UT + FL. 

I will defeat all of these undemocratic bills.

#DCStatehood #HandsOffDC

I spoke to @SegravesNBC4 about the future of the #FreedomToVoteAct, voting rights in general, and #DCStatehood.

Watch on @NBCWashington tonight at 5:00 and 6:15. https://t.co/Q0LTKcz8Ur

.@WashingtonPost columnist @byTheresaVargas wrote an excellent piece about @SenTedCruz's interference in DC vaccine policy and how the remedy is #DCStatehood.

Read it here: https://t.co/uS2hynV5jC
More: https://t.co/ear4GcHHS9

As the first woman to chair @USEEOC, which enforces pay equity laws, I will introduce a bill to require employers to provide salary range for jobs in ads & interviews & to existing employees.

Salary transparency is an important tool to combat the gender & race wage gap.

End the filibuster. Protect the right to vote. It's time. 

#PassItOn https://t.co/xH2Z9pAtGj

Ahead of #MLKDay, I’m calling on the Senate to complete the nation’s work on civil rights by passing comprehensive voting rights legislation and the #DCStatehood bill.

As the chair of the Highways and Transit Subcommittee and as a member of the Government Operations Subcommittee, I’ve been working closely with Chairman @GerryConnolly on this Metro hearing. 

We need answers and accountability. https://t.co/jmjGE9p10O

Passing the #BuildBackBetter Act is critical to making our economy work for families across DC. 65 million kids count on the monthly #ChildTaxCredit checks. 

We cannot let the progress DC families made thanks to the American Rescue Plan end here. https://t.co/roWVPM9Dtu
More: https://t.co/Xt7OYQwznL

.@RepMattGaetz of FL yesterday became the 5th Republican to try to block a D.C. vaccine policy this Congress, joining members from TX and UT in these futile efforts.

I will defeat his undemocratic bill, just like I will defeat the four others. #HandsOffDC #DCStatehood
@mex_dc @POTUS @MayorBowser #DCStatehood

After learning of recent layoffs @USPS in the face of DC-wide complaints of delayed and undelivered mail, I sent Postmaster General DeJoy a letter asking for answers.

Senator Harry Reid, who is lying in state at the Capitol today, gave new momentum to our #DCStatehood bill when, as Majority Leader in 2013, he announced at the unveiling of DC’s first statue in the Capitol he would cosponsor the bill and forcefully called for its passage.

The #Jan6 attack reminds us how crucial it is to give DC control of its National Guard, just as states and territories control theirs.

Release: https://t.co/pcywXxztCG
I’m disappointed that @DeptofDefense didn’t call on Congress to give the DC mayor control of the DC National Guard when it recently streamlined the approval process for deploying the DCNG.
Details: https://t.co/8RKpUrNOr7

Tomorrow, I will hold a virtual community meeting on the Supreme Court's new vehicle barrier on a residential street.

This meeting will allow residents to share their concerns about the barrier and to find a solution that works for them and the Court.
Read: https://t.co/ZTzVc6mLg5

This weekend, the @WashingtonPost Editorial Board called on the Senate to confirm local DC judges.

The extraordinary number of judicial vacancies on the local DC courts has become a crisis, standing in the way of cases residents need resolved, public safety + access to justice.
There is no constitutional requirement that such judges be subject to Senate confirmation.

One seat has been vacant since… 2013.

The Senate must immediately confirm the pending nominees, and Congress must pass my bill to get rid of the confirmation requirement for DC judges, who are Article I judges.

Longstanding Senate inaction has created a judicial vacancy crisis on the local DC courts that is harming public safety and access to justice.

There are 16 vacancies out of 62 seats on the trial court, and 3 vacancies out of 9 seats on the appeals court.
@DCStatehood_ Booo.

I spoke to @JulieMason on Sirius XM this morning about interference by @SenTedCruz in DC's student vaccine policy, voting rights, and #DCStatehood. 

Listen here: https://t.co/Ku6zWVrtVM

Today I introduced a bill to allow DC to transmit legislation for the congressional review period electronically.

Currently, DC must physically transmit legislation. 

As Omicron surges, email is the safest + fastest way to send legislation to Congress.

https://t.co/oX2i8LdmnS
@jc_s1 Good morning!
Now: Ahead of MLK Day, I'll speak to @JulieMason on Sirius XM about MLK's legacy of support for voting rights, including #DCStatehood.
@VictoriaBonney @51stDC @51for51 @DCstatehood51 #DCStatehood
@Ward3Statehood @DCStatehood_ Boooo.
Control is not only about DC’s right to self-government. It’s also a matter of life and death.

During the #Jan6 attack, the nation learned the president controls the DC National Guard. 

As governors deploy their NGs to respond to the COVID surge, I again call on Congress to pass my bill to give the DC mayor control of the DC Guard.

This Congress, 4 Republicans have announced bills to overturn DC vaccine policies. 3 from TX, 1 from UT. 

All profess to support local control of local affairs yet are trying to use fed power to overturn local policies. 

I'll defeat their undemocratic bills. 

#HandsOffDC

Yesterday, @SenTedCruz announced his intention to introduce a bill blocking DC's vaccine mandate for students. 

I assure you, I will defeat this anti-science, anti-student, anti-home-rule bill from a senator from Texas. 

#HandsOffDC

Details: https://t.co/YYKI6mIKDC
These officers and the nearly 700,000 DC residents continue to lack the voting representation in Congress and local self-government other Americans have long enjoyed. #DCStatehood

This afternoon, I’ll be speaking at a vigil remembering the #January6thInsurrection on the National Mall. It is important we remember this assault on our democracy, but also recognize the sacrifice of @DCPoliceDept officers.
See my release: https://t.co/2tJRT5pGEp

DC residents pay the highest per capita federal taxes in the country yet are denied voting representation in Congress, including members of MPD who helped save the Capitol and democracy itself that day, and full self-government. It’s long past time for #DCStatehood.

One year after the insurrection at the Capitol, we are reminded that this was not just an attack on the Capitol, but on #DC itself. DC has no control over its National Guard, and its police force can be federalized.

See my release:
https://t.co/Rg2gdR1K6a

This week, I will introduce a bill to make DC eligible for forestry education funding. States and territories are already eligible. This is the 21st bill in my Free and Equal D.C. Series of bills to ensure that, pending #DCStatehood, DC is treated the same as states.

With DC’s COVID-19 vaccination mandate for entering many facilities going into effect January 15, defeating @RepPatFallon’s anti-home-rule bill that would prohibit #DC from imposing such a mandate is more important than ever. #HandsOffDC

Release: https://t.co/bFyeNbBd16

Until then, the Senate needs to immediately confirm the pending DC nominees, and Congress needs to pass my bill to allow DC judges to be appointed after a congressional review period, which is the same process for DC legislation.

#DCStatehood is the solution to the local DC judicial vacancy crisis.
https://t.co/XWQHa3B50P
@ChelseaCirruzzo 🛷🌨️

Sledding is a simple childhood thrill, and allowing children to sled on Capitol Hill is the least we can give them after a challenging year.

Release: https://t.co/3hwMEdbXqz

I released a statement today reminding DC residents that sledding is allowed on Capitol Hill because of a provision I get added to the Legislative Branch Appropriations bill, but the Hill is temporarily closed due to falling branches.  I hope it will reopen later today.
@TalkNats @instagram #DCStatehood
@theHillisHome Yes, I can.
@SharonsSpeaking Wasn't me.
#DCStatehood https://t.co/g7ypdbBYbl
The House passed our #DCStatehood bill again in April. In the new year, we will face the remaining challenges by redoubling our efforts to pass our statehood bill in the Senate.
The nearly 700,000 Americans who live in DC and pay federal taxes deserve voting representation in the House and Senate and control over their local affairs.

All I want for Christmas is… #DCStatehood. 

Congress has the constitutional authority to grant that wish by simple legislation. https://t.co/AmRaXZKCnr
Thank you to my excellent District Office team for another wonderful year helping my constituents! https://t.co/95WJizbNie
Thank you to my interns for a successful semester! https://t.co/3PPBEFk5YY
